title: 'I found a £66,000 pension from years ago': how to track down a lost pot
text:
More than £19bn of pension savings have been “lost”, according to recent research, equating to almost two million pots.

Workers will frequently have numerous jobs in their life and modern auto-enrolment rules mean they are likely to start paying into a pension at all of them, amassing a number of small pension funds which can be easily forgotten.

Earlier this month the Government finally unveiled its pension bill, paving the way for the development of a “pensions dashboard”. The long-awaited technology would allow savers to view all of their pensions in one place, making managing them far easier.
